oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SOLVENT-EXTRACTION SEPARATION OF COBALT(II) FROM NICKEL AND OTHER METALS WITH CYANEX-272
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GANDHI, MN
DEORKAR, NV
KHOPKAR, SM
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cobalt(II) was quantitatively extracted at pH 8.0 with 5 x 10(-3)M Cyanex 272 [Bis(2,4,4 trimethyl pentyl) phosphoric acid] in chloroform. Cobalt(II) was stripped with 0.5M nitric acid and was determined by atomic absorption spectrometry as well as by spectrophotometry of the complex with nitroso R salt. Cobalt(II) was separated from vanadium, chromium, nickel, manganese, iron and zinc. Mixtures having different ratios of iron, cobalt and nickel were separated by proposed method.
